intro: Mycaranthes anceps, commonly known as the African ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Mesembryanthemaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that open at night, a trait that aids in its pollination by nocturnal insects.
